poem:
**The Mirror of Innocence**  

In the house of fashion,  
where mirrors reflect the past,  
a mother sews the cloak of self,  
to drape upon her child's small frame.  
Blue dreams ripple between them,  
waves caught upon the thread,  
a quiet language spoken  
in the loom of lineage,  
where innocence learns the weight  
of woven identities.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What’s behind the return of mini-me dressing? The Princess of Wales and her 10-year-old daughter, Princess Charlotte, seemed to have shared not just a carriage but also outfit notes at trooping the colour last weekend, since they were both wearing neighbouring blues on the colour wheel. They do it a lot, this so-called “mini-me dressing” – via tartans and tiaras, nautical details and nifty colour accents. She’s not the only one. Kim Kardashian does it". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
